segment.source: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment

segment.source: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment

segment.source: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment
segment.target: Results for the Driver Verification Assessment

segment.source: The Driver Verification assessment helps you verify that your offline Windows image or a running Windows operating system contains the correct set of drivers.
segment.target: The Driver Verification assessment helps you verify that your offline Windows image or a running Windows operating system contains the correct set of drivers.

segment.source: The results help you identify issues such as missing, unnecessary and outdated drivers.
segment.target: The results help you identify issues such as missing, unnecessary and outdated drivers.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: For more information about system requirements and assessment settings, see Driver Verification.
segment.target: For more information about system requirements and assessment settings, see Driver Verification.

segment.source: Goals File
segment.target: Goals File

segment.source: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.
segment.target: You can create custom goals to measure your improvements in the Results View.

segment.source: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.
segment.target: Goals files are a triage tool that can help you understand how a PC is performing and to compare PCs in your business.

segment.source: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.
segment.target: For example, goals for a basic laptop might be different than the goals you set for a high end desktop computer, or market expectations might change in such a way that you want the flexibility to define different goals and key requirements as time passes and technology improves.

segment.source: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:
segment.target: When a metric value is compared to the goal for that metric, the status is color coded in the Result View as follows:

segment.source: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.
segment.target: Light purple means that the system has a great user experience and that there are no perceived problems.

segment.source: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.
segment.target: Medium purple means that the user experience is tolerable and you can optimize the system.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see what improvements can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.
segment.target: Dark purple means that the system has a poor user experience and that there is significant room for improvements.

segment.source: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.
segment.target: Review the recommendations and analysis to see the improvements that can be made to the system.

segment.source: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.
segment.target: These can be software changes, configuration changes or hardware changes.

segment.source: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.
segment.target: You might have to consider making tradeoffs to deliver a high quality Windows experience.

segment.source: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.
segment.target: No color means that there are no goals defined for the metric.

segment.source: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.
segment.target: In the Windows Assessment Toolkit for Windows 8, some assessments include default goals files.

segment.source: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.
segment.target: The first time you view results using this version of the tools, the default goals file is used.

segment.source: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.
segment.target: However, you can also define custom goals for Windows 8 the same way that you can for Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.

segment.source: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.
segment.target: You can set the goals file location and add a goals file to that location before you can use the UI to apply the custom goals.

segment.source: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.
segment.target: Once a goals file is selected it will continue to be the goals file that is used for any results that are opened.

segment.source: Only one goals file can be used at a time.
segment.target: Only one goals file can be used at a time.

segment.source: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.
segment.target: Goals for all assessments are set in a single goals file.

segment.source: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:
segment.target: The assessment tools will search for goals in the following order:

segment.source: A custom goals file
segment.target: A custom goals file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the results file
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the results file

segment.source: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest
segment.target: Goals that are defined in the assessment manifest

segment.source: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.
segment.target: You can use the sample goals file that is provided at %PROGRAMFILES%Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitWindows Assessment ToolkitSDKSamplesGoals to create your own goals file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.
segment.target: You cannot package a goals file with a job, but you can store it on a share for others to use.

segment.source: Metrics
segment.target: Metrics

segment.source: The Driver Verification assessment evaluates the drivers on your computer and produces results that can help you manage the drivers that are installed.
segment.target: The Driver Verification assessment evaluates the drivers on your computer and produces results that can help you manage the drivers that are installed.

segment.source: The following table describes the metrics that are available after you run the Driver Verification assessment.
segment.target: The following table describes the metrics that are available after you run the Driver Verification assessment.

segment.source: Metric
segment.target: Metric

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: All Devices
segment.target: All Devices

segment.source: Lists all devices that the assessment discovered.
segment.target: Lists all devices that the assessment discovered.

segment.source: You can expand the metric to see a list of devices and to identify the device name and device class.
segment.target: You can expand the metric to see a list of devices and to identify the device name and device class.

segment.source: Devices with Other Issues
segment.target: Devices with Other Issues

segment.source: The number of devices that have other issues than those specifically listed in this table.
segment.target: The number of devices that have other issues than those specifically listed in this table.

segment.source: Devices Missing Drivers
segment.target: Devices Missing Drivers

segment.source: The number of devices that have missing drivers.
segment.target: The number of devices that have missing drivers.

segment.source: You can expand this metric to see a list of the devices that are missing a driver and to identify the device names and device classes.
segment.target: You can expand this metric to see a list of the devices that are missing a driver and to identify the device names and device classes.

segment.source: Devices with Driver Updates Available
segment.target: Devices with Driver Updates Available

segment.source: The number of devices that have driver updates available.
segment.target: The number of devices that have driver updates available.

segment.source: You can expand this metric to see a list of devices and to identify the device name, a better driver, the driver file, the driver vendor and the driver version.
segment.target: You can expand this metric to see a list of devices and to identify the device name, a better driver, the driver file, the driver vendor and the driver version.

segment.source: Devices with Multiple Drivers
segment.target: Devices with Multiple Drivers

segment.source: The number of devices that have multiple drivers.
segment.target: The number of devices that have multiple drivers.

segment.source: You can expand this metric to see a list of devices with more than one associated driver and to identify the device name and device class.
segment.target: You can expand this metric to see a list of devices with more than one associated driver and to identify the device name and device class.

segment.source: Legacy Devices
segment.target: Legacy Devices

segment.source: The number of devices that were identified as legacy devices.
segment.target: The number of devices that were identified as legacy devices.

segment.source: You can expand this metric to see a list of legacy devices and to identify the device name, device class, device description, instance ID and device manufacturer.
segment.target: You can expand this metric to see a list of legacy devices and to identify the device name, device class, device description, instance ID and device manufacturer.

segment.source: Unnecessary Drivers
segment.target: Unnecessary Drivers

segment.source: The number of devices that have unnecessary software drivers that are not associated with any hardware device.
segment.target: The number of devices that have unnecessary software drivers that are not associated with any hardware device.

segment.source: You can expand this metric to see a list of unnecessary drivers and to identify the driver file, driver description driver vendor, and driver versions.
segment.target: You can expand this metric to see a list of unnecessary drivers and to identify the driver file, driver description driver vendor, and driver versions.

segment.source: Issues
segment.target: Issues

segment.source: The Driver Verification assessment identifies issues with drivers, provides information about the way that these issues affect the system, and suggests possible resolutions.
segment.target: The Driver Verification assessment identifies issues with drivers, provides information about the way that these issues affect the system, and suggests possible resolutions.

segment.source: The following issues and recommendations can appear after you run the Driver Verification assessment.
segment.target: The following issues and recommendations can appear after you run the Driver Verification assessment.

segment.source: Issue descriptions, recommendations and links to additional information are also available in the UI.
segment.target: Issue descriptions, recommendations and links to additional information are also available in the UI.

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Recommendation
segment.target: Recommendation

segment.source: Missing Driver
segment.target: Missing Driver

segment.source: There was no driver found for this device.
segment.target: There was no driver found for this device.

segment.source: The device will not work without the appropriate driver.
segment.target: The device will not work without the appropriate driver.

segment.source: When connected to the Internet, search Windows Update for the driver for this device.
segment.target: When connected to the Internet, search Windows Update for the driver for this device.

segment.source: To automatically search Windows Update for missing drivers, run the assessment again while connected to the Internet and use the default settings.
segment.target: To automatically search Windows Update for missing drivers, run the assessment again while connected to the Internet and use the default settings.

segment.source: In some cases you might have to contact the OEM or the device manufacturer to obtain the driver.
segment.target: In some cases you might have to contact the OEM or the device manufacturer to obtain the driver.

segment.source: Multiple Drivers
segment.target: Multiple Drivers

segment.source: Lists devices with more than one available driver.
segment.target: Lists devices with more than one available driver.

segment.source: Extra drivers waste space and can contain vulnerabilities that compromise computer security.
segment.target: Extra drivers waste space and can contain vulnerabilities that compromise computer security.

segment.source: We recommend that you include only required drivers.
segment.target: We recommend that you include only required drivers.

segment.source: Remove the extra drivers from the offline image by using DISM, or uninstall the drivers from the running computer by using Device Manager.
segment.target: Remove the extra drivers from the offline image by using DISM, or uninstall the drivers from the running computer by using Device Manager.

segment.source: For more information about how to use DISM to remove drivers, see Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about how to use DISM to remove drivers, see Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Unnecessary Drivers
segment.target: Unnecessary Drivers

segment.source: Lists drivers not associated with any of the available hardware devices.
segment.target: Lists drivers not associated with any of the available hardware devices.

segment.source: Unnecessary drivers could be either a software or service driver.
segment.target: Unnecessary drivers could be either a software or service driver.

segment.source: If you do not use this software or service, consider removing it.
segment.target: If you do not use this software or service, consider removing it.

segment.source: Extra drivers can be removed offline using DISM, or by using Device Manager.
segment.target: Extra drivers can be removed offline using DISM, or by using Device Manager.

segment.source: See Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: See Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Updated Better Driver
segment.target: Updated Better Driver

segment.source: An updated driver is available.
segment.target: An updated driver is available.

segment.source: We recommend that you update the driver for optimal device functionality.
segment.target: We recommend that you update the driver for optimal device functionality.

segment.source: There is a more up-to-date driver available on Windows Update.
segment.target: There is a more up-to-date driver available on Windows Update.

segment.source: Use the provided link to download the driver or contact the device manufacturer for additional updates.
segment.target: Use the provided link to download the driver or contact the device manufacturer for additional updates.

segment.source: See Windows Update Driver Publishing for information about how to use Windows Update.
segment.target: See Windows Update Driver Publishing for information about how to use Windows Update.

segment.source: Legacy Devices
segment.target: Legacy Devices

segment.source: Lists the devices that do not have a Plug and Play ID.
segment.target: Lists the devices that do not have a Plug and Play ID.

segment.source: The Microsoft Device Association Root Enumerator device does not have a Plug and Play ID.
segment.target: The Microsoft Device Association Root Enumerator device does not have a Plug and Play ID.

segment.source: Such devices cannot be evaluated by this assessment.
segment.target: Such devices cannot be evaluated by this assessment.

segment.source: Use alternative methods to verify the functionality of this device.
segment.target: Use alternative methods to verify the functionality of this device.

segment.source: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006
segment.target: The assessment reports an exit code of 0x80050006

segment.source: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.
segment.target: This error occurs when maintenance tasks have been registered on the PC but have not completed before the assessment run.

segment.source: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.
segment.target: This prevents the assessment from running, as maintenance tasks often impact assessment metrics.

segment.source: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:
segment.target: To resolve this issue, do one of the following:

segment.source: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.
segment.target: Ensure that the computer is connected to a network and is running on AC power.

segment.source: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:
segment.target: Manually initiate pending maintenance tasks with the following command from an elevated prompt:

segment.source: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
segment.target: Disable regular and idle maintenance tasks, and stop all maintenance tasks before running the assessment.
